modules.description: This module implements a Redis client for asynchronous messaging, handling connection setup, message sending, and stream-based message reception. It works with Redis channels using custom message types defined in `Message_t`, supporting operations like joining a channel, sending messages, and handling incoming messages either through a stream or a callback. Concrete use cases include real-time chat systems, event broadcasting, and distributed task coordination over Redis pub/sub channels.

This module handles JSON serialization and deserialization for three core types: `privmsg`, `message`, and `send`. It provides functions to convert these types to and from JSON strings, using either direct string operations or buffer-based output. These operations are essential for processing and transmitting structured message data in JSON format, particularly in contexts like network communication or data storage.

This module defines data structures for representing IRC-like messages, including private messages, join events, and part events. It provides types for parsing and constructing messages with source, destination, and content fields, as well as commands for sending structured messages. Concrete use cases include handling chat events in a Redis-backed messaging system and serializing/deserializing message payloads for network transmission.

This module implements a Redis-based messaging system with asynchronous communication capabilities. It provides structured message handling through custom IRC-like message types, along with JSON serialization for message transmission. Concrete use cases include real-time chat applications, distributed event notification systems, and Redis-backed task queues using publish/subscribe or stream-based messaging.
